![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/bannernewsletter.png)

This is April's Turing-Roche newsletter! Here you can find what's new in the Turing-Roche strategic partnership and opportunities, events and news from both the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and wider relevant networks.

Our [five year partnership](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F31_0K30lsHTc3j5EgfVYjQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455968582392%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=HNM8qmaOaGmC5CJxIVj3PDxFbiLe3sX9eqBEuw2I8lk%3D&reserved=0) was officially launched in June 2021. Our 'North Star' is **to enable the generation of insights to better understand patient and disease heterogeneity and its relevance to clinical outcomes at an unprecedented level of precision in order to improve clinical care.**

We are developing multiple research activities over the five years to work towards our North Star, as well as building strong connections and collaborations between the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and the broader community.

If you have anything you'd like featured in a future newsletter then please get in touch with Vicky Hellon, Community Manager for the partnership at <vhellon@turing.ac.uk>

If you would like to share this newsletter with relevant colleagues please direct them to sign-up [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FbkF3Nurvd8TKUwvn_uYTKg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455968582392%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=AY2ND7zyQ6bH8aP%2BSxOTXX9u590prjLIEg20EhL88jQ%3D&reserved=0).

## Turing-Roche Strategic Partnership Updates

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/photo-1457530378978-8bac673b8062.jfif)

### Knowledge Share Series Event: Fairness in AI for Health

**30 April 2024**

Join us for our monthly [partnership knowledge share series](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FkWGO_VXxVOaEBc8SC8rKsA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455968582392%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=luv6ZYCZn3S8bIwZamjCGzNMrLkYojTJd3d21lwIrA0%3D&reserved=0). Our aim is to bring together members of the Turing and Roche networks and the wider scientific community to hear partnership research updates and share different academic and industry perspectives on areas related to patient/treatment heterogeneity and data science more generally.

April's event is on the 30th and we will be hearing from Leandra Bräuninger, a PhD student at University College London and Adarsh Srivastava, Head of Data and Analytics Quality Assurance at Roche, on the topic of 'Fairness in AI for Health'. You can register for the event [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FTDs_Xktu8UaB0UFm3AVbEw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455968582392%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=1NPviZbsxKjsFDSMxKD79EgATwOhoscBbMCbuBq6iVI%3D&reserved=0). 

You can catch-up on previous recordings of our events at our [YouTube channel](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FKcZFg1R5kACG1Zn2kzei0w&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455968738625%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=1qo39t7BEKFTOA9I0ppHJt1lcPklSnNIogZVQjwj46A%3D&reserved=0).

### Applications open for Research Associate positions in the partnership

We're hiring for two Research Associates, full time for 2 years, within the partnership. The post holders will work on computational statistics and deep learning with applications in biomedicine. These are exciting opportunities for researchers with a strong background in statistical methodology and applied data analysis, who would like to grow that skill set further as well as collaborate as part of a diverse team comprising individuals across both academia and industry. More info and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Ff-UzXrl5fmSfkEkVtCHM1g&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455968738625%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=51XpY02AthR7dn8nKEmXhRmzuMFmGd9Boavfh3Pkw9I%3D&reserved=0)- please share widely!

### New animated video explainer on Structured Missingness from our Community Scholar

Our partnership Community Scholar Syafiq Ramlee has created an animated video explainer on the partnership's research theme of Structured Missingness. 

The [Community Scholar scheme](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPTNMTE42THEteTdpbXpSeVZxY1l2anBYVUR5YnNzSVZma09rVWtCaVBEaGViV2RxVTRmOHhBTmZzT3AxaWFxX3EmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi00ZjQzODczZjVlNTk0NDM2OTYwYjI0MzRiYjQ4NjM5YSZlc2lkPTJkMjhhNGZkLWRlZjctZWUxMS1hMWZlLTYwNDViZGYxZDIxYyJ9%2FkJb5og-ShrolQJxNNElACQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455968738625%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=TWjrqz5L6wY7Hg%2FBIwNUmh2FROGgfwzDOnWxi3bZjVE%3D&reserved=0) is supporting 10 PhD students to embed themselves within the partnership community, attend a relevant conference and undertake their own community-based project. Syafiq's project is creating a video explainer for each of the three partnership's research themes and two more videos on our other themes of Predictive Modelling and Multi-Modal Analysis respectively will follow later in the year. 

Check out the Structured Missingness video [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FP34jt7CJYLv3RgvYYeWDlw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455968738625%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=63tCUSLy2ZToZIVNFenwe8QEJ94WyzN2zRpPJ2ul5%2BI%3D&reserved=0)!

### Turing-Roche Theme Lead Tapabrata (Rohan) Chakraborty speaker at Human-Centered AI Book Launch Event

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/rohanbooklaunch.jpg?m=4/10/2024%203:24:25%20PM)

Our partnership Theme Lead [Rohan](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F6vUT9cL8iGe-LKx4fXKMWA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455968894913%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=bxUE8nOABTFTmapEOw7i7%2Bty%2FtjM%2BsK54XlLIIipLww%3D&reserved=0) was recently part of an event marking the publication of the book [Human-Centered AI: A Multidisciplinary Perspective for Policy-Makers, Auditors, and Users](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FMp81qbkgKH6HQed0EdiDUw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455968894913%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=2M64KngcyjCxM61uDN4oxa13iSP0Xa1TvOvRf9at9jQ%3D&reserved=0), which he co-wrote a chapter for. The event, held at Jesus College Cambridge, brought together attendees to engage in thought-provoking conversations on how we can ensure that AI serves to enhance human well-being, and explored the ways in which the integration of human values and experiences shapes the trajectory of AI systems.

### Partnership Research Associate Anthony Baptista presenting at CompleNet Conference 2024

Our partnership research associate [Anthony](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FHi8nXEFG8dlOfJRcNijiYQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455968894913%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=OLu0Sueg16llntw533FEA5%2FQSdDb8t9EIr7u2wJbCis%3D&reserved=0), who works within our Structured Missingness Research Theme, will be presenting his research at the [International Conference on Complex Networks](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPTNMTE42THEteTdpbXpSeVZxY1l2anBYVUR5YnNzSVZma09rVWtCaVBEaGViV2RxVTRmOHhBTmZzT3AxaWFxX3EmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi00ZjQzODczZjVlNTk0NDM2OTYwYjI0MzRiYjQ4NjM5YSZlc2lkPTJkMjhhNGZkLWRlZjctZWUxMS1hMWZlLTYwNDViZGYxZDIxYyJ9%2F9lJsJIj8AQkEbrETC7u9dQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455969051161%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=87kFs4dvvC3iMSxUjAIESttZSK5fIBn%2BUqPxiFlxoAk%3D&reserved=0) (CompleNet) at the University of Exeter. 

His talk 'Mining Higher-Order Triadic Interactions in Structured Missingness and Gene-Expression data' will be on the 4th day of the conference (April 26th) in the Network Topology and Geometry session.

### Turing Connections PhD Student Presentation and Networking Event Liverpool- May 2024
**Registration deadline: 10 May 2024**
**Event: 31 May 2024**

As part of the 'Turing Connections' initiative, the Turing Institute is hosting a free event for PhD students across the UK. The event at the University of Liverpool will feature student presentations, a networking session and complimentary lunch. Find out more and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FZMgkeP8qB5iTwhf_fXgG5g&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455969051161%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=OtKlcnip5w7xL433vOqEL5Uq0ShbitLC99%2F4V7l9Ar0%3D&reserved=0).

### Roche Principal Scientist Role- Computational Sciences Digital Pathology

Applications are open for a Principal Scientist role in Genentech Research and Development (gRED), part of the Roche group. They are looking for a motivated scientist to drive translational medicine and research efforts in drug development and biomarker development. The successful applicant will apply image analysis and machine learning in collaboration with a group of computational and biological scientists to perform digital pathology research for programs in research and clinical development. Find out more and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FwIIscAtIe9RpHgjSwPEeuw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455969051161%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=NCUTo9Lj87NPs6wYyJouQ%2BjcHLT3TsClRy%2FocNNeomY%3D&reserved=0).

## Events

### SAIL Databank Showcase Webinar Series: Multi-morbidity and modelling using real-world routinely-collected data

**18 April 2024**

The SAIL databank webinar series is open to all SAIL Databank users and anyone interested in hearing further information on this research theme and wider SAIL updates. This month's theme is 'Multi-morbidity and modelling using real-world routinely-collected data' and will feature speakers from Swansea University, University of Southampton and Loughborough University. Further info and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FX_JLqJNbaL8nS_eWevA-Sg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455969207427%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=yE88iVSPODBDXLvHcHEbrchKzl5HMH72fjqGSBOuPAU%3D&reserved=0).

### International Communication Association (ICA) Health Communication Division's Conversation Series 'Artificial Intelligence: Possibilities for Health Care and Health Communication'

**22 April 2024**

The ICA Health Communication Division will be sponsoring a third run of the 'Conversation Series' for early career scholars. The first online Zoom session is on 'Artificial Intelligence: Possibilities for Health Care and Health Communication'. ### Apply to join the Royal Statistical Society (RSS) AI Task Force

**Deadline: 23 April 2024**

At its March meeting, RSS's Council approved the creation of a new RSS task force focusing on artificial intelligence. They are now seeking applications from RSS members who are interested in either joining or chairing the group. 

The RSS has a large number of groups with an interest in AI -- a key aim of the task force will be to bring together a representative set of views on AI and help to strategically plan  work in this area. They intend the group both to help communication between RSS members with an interest in the subject and to help raise the profile of the RSS's work on this topic. Find out more and how to apply to be on the task force [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FkSMi3CAVucQUwRjh9FgPbw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455969676175%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=UXaXCC9g%2FY0qgvtDozk9JZal46DtFg8%2F4AzKiv04jfc%3D&reserved=0).

### Call for papers at The Trustworthy AI Workshop at the 2024 International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI)

**Paper submission deadline: 26 April 2024**

**Notification of paper acceptance: 04 June 2024**

**Workshop: 03-09 August 2024**

The Trustworthy AI workshop at IJCAI 2024 aims to bring researchers, policymakers, and regulators together to discuss ways to ensure security and transparency while addressing fundamental problems in developing countries, particularly when data and models are imported and/or collected locally with less focus on ethical considerations and governance guidelines.

If you're interested in presenting your work, please submit a 4-page paper (4 pages for content and 2 for references) following the [IJCAI Author Kit ](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fxosa9J5YDZi2oRkmCPXyZQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455969676175%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=WeSbtbooMADeevQcMM0DJx3tsps%2BbwjDCKcvyHRB4uY%3D&reserved=0)format, at [this site](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FotD0TY9uHexEytmC4S2bww&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455969676175%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=k2D1i%2Bquk2Fe7ydTbXp7O1onOtd3EdtrrE6%2Bgqr%2BYwQ%3D&reserved=0). All submissions will be double-blind peer-reviewed by program committee members, with at least 2 submitted reviews per work.

### Cancer Research UK (CRUK): Data Community Support Unit

CRUK is building a cancer data science community to support researchers in tackling common challenges, sharing best practices and driving data culture change.

The Data Community Support Unit (DCSU) was recently established to help shape researcher-led data activities and support a connected and collaborative data community. The unit involves six community groups of data experts, each led by a key member of the DCSU governance board, focussing on different research data challenge areas.

CRUK are looking for members of the research data community to join these groups and help develop services and solutions taking a data-intensive approach to support the cancer community. Follow [this link](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FdAr_PPnKf9YHWvKLEn8L3A&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455969988671%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=LTaC5G08fvOXtd21GrsgC3vNtCdCZij3st7EUb3kW%2BY%3D&reserved=0) to register your interest.

## Featured Community Scholar of the Month

In September 2023 we welcomed our first cohort of Turing-Roche Community Scholars: 10 UK PhD students who are joining the partnership for 12 months to develop community-based projects for the partnership, alongside their ongoing PhD studies. Each month we are featuring a different scholar in our newsletter.

You can find out more about our community scholars [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F1FnvDk1Lhn0OI8JcjTyi3w&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455969988671%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=LF%2FAzmve5dP0gIc0EPDFQk3ij8kW%2FS5a1SrFbVTkoZ0%3D&reserved=0). You can also see more about their plans for their projects [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FQytfwHqphKDv9tpYBC-qpQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455969988671%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=UqJmU2jzUGPMpy0HK%2FQVfaWKgBAXWlx2OvVwF1dy9Jk%3D&reserved=0).

This month's scholar is Davy Tennison, from University College London. 

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/davy_headshot.jpg)

**Tell us a little bit about yourself and your current research:**

Hello! My name is Davy and I'm a PhD student in UCL's STS (Science, Technology & Society) department. I have a french bulldog called Strider, and I enjoy sci-fi and fantasy, running, and playing the guitar (badly). My work falls more on the philosophical side of things, particularly philosophy of medicine. I'm researching contested illnesses (illnesses currently lacking scientific consensus, like fibromyalgia) and why the doctor-patient relationship breaks down so often in these cases, to the detriment of the patient. To do this I am using the lens of epistemic injustice (who is considered to be a "knower" in certain spaces, in this case the healthcare establishment) with a view to highlight injustice, and improve patient experiences and outcomes.

**What is your planned community scholar project? Why is this of interest to you?**

Along with my wonderful colleague Florence, I am making a podcast about multimodal health data. So far we've recorded episodes on wearables, health apps, the use of AI in hospitals, and the use of AI specifically in surgery. I have also recorded a vox-pop style episode at the AI UK 2024 conference - and I'm really hoping the audio is going to be of good enough quality for me to weave into an episode as I spoke with so many interesting people and learned about so much fascinating, cutting-edge research! I love this project because I get to deep dive into areas I previously only had a shallow understanding of, as well as challenging my audio editing and podcast making skills. I also think Florence and I are well balanced as hosts, as she knows so much about the hard science side of things, and I get to bring in my STS commentary (e.g. the historical, societal, philosophical context of the tech we're discussing). Episodes should be coming out in the next few months - so watch this space. We're so excited for you to listen. 

PS: We really wanted to call our podcast Vital Signs - but it turns out that name has been snapped up by like 8 other medical podcasts, so we've gone with Data-Day Health - what do we think? Catchy or groan-worthy? Feedback appreciated!

**What is your favourite movie, book or TV show?**

Terry Pratchett's Discworld series holds a special place in my heart. In school I actually got in trouble for only reading and re-reading the discworld series on a loop - so I was given the BBC's top 100 literature books list and told to read through them all before I could go back to Pratchett (which of course, I did at lightning speed, because nothing was going to stop me going back to the Discworld). Of them all, I think Monstrous Regiment is my favourite. 

## Publication of the Month

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/patrick-tomasso-oaqk7qqnh_c-unsplash2.jpg)

### The uselessness of AI ethics

This month's selected publication is [this paper](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FvMsG_K1e6iZltdvGV8IL4Q&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C9d87850fe24943ff711508dc5ec6fd79%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638489455969988671%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=bCcMV9qdteVG3qzESRCWgKuXW196xhcnKAcc%2Be7%2BhZQ%3D&reserved=0), chosen by our featured Community Scholar Davy Tennison. 

'This is an STS paper discussing the limitations of ethical guidelines and frameworks for AI systems. I came across this paper recently at a departmental reading group, and it really chimed with the work I'd been doing with Florence on the podcast - in terms of discussing limitations and potential ethical issues or hurdles with AI as applied to health and medicine. In a nutshell, the author argues that the words used in AI ethical guidelines are often vague or meaningless (e.g. saying AI should be "fair" - to whom? What does "fair" mean in this context?); that the guidelines are isolated within a wider culture of tech education and business that sidelines understanding and implementation of ethics; and that these guidelines are "toothless" - in that there's no real sanctions or enforcement mechanisms around ethical principles at the moment. As AI becomes more powerful and more integrated into every aspect of our lives, I think considerations like the ones laid out by this author are important to keep in mind.'
